page.title: 05ANCIENT CRAFTS
page.content: At Aldingham we saw two men putting slates back on the roof because the pieces of wood that were underneath had gone rotten and they were replacing them. They had gone rotten because some slates had fallen off and rainfall had got into the wood and made the wood damp and rotten. First you have to put the roofing timber on and then put the roofing felt on to protect the wood.They then put the slates on. They shape the slates into shape by chopping it with a special tool like a long bladed axe along the edge of a wooden plank. They leave a shape on the other end like half of an hexagon which has a hole in.It takes them about fifteen seconds to shape the slates.Then they nail the slates so they over lap like bricks on a wall each one covering a crack then the job is done.
